Description: Terracotta lamp. Applied vertical band-handle. Discus decorated with St Andrew's cross, with palmettes between the arms. On shoulder, above a row of raised points near the carination, alternating palmettes and leaves (vases?). Nozzle-top shows a cross, with palmettes between the arms. Pointed oval base-ring. Pinkish-brown clay, with mica covered with a red slip. Handle lost.
Curator's comments: Near: UC 34978, in Petrie Museum, London, from Coptos; Bruyère, B., 1966. ‘Fouilles de Clysma-Qolzoum (Suez) 1930-1932’. Cairo : L'Institut français d'archéologie orientale, pls XVIII, XXXII.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (2237)
